main_definition: In simple English, 'abstracts' can refer to condensed versions of papers or presentations at conferences, a conceptual idea that is not concrete, or written summaries of longer texts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Summaries of research papers presented at academic or professional conferences
meanings_and_examples.example: At the conference, each speaker provided an abstract before their presentation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idea that is not tangible or concrete
meanings_and_examples.example: The concept of love can be considered an 'abstract' because it cannot physically exist.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A brief written summary of a longer work, such as a book, article, or report
meanings_and_examples.example: I read the abstract of this research paper to understand its main findings and methodology.
